alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Davidson; Marshall; Rutherford; Sumner; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 11:28AM CST until March 03 at 12:15PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Northeastern Marshall County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... Eastern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Bedford County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 1215 PM CST. * At 1128 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Franklin to 8 miles east of Thompson`s Station to 11 miles north of Lewisburg, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Gallatin, Lebanon, Hendersonville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Mount Juliet, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Lakewood, Thompson`s Station, Watertown, Hermitage, Walterhill, Rural Hill and Antioch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 210 and 247. Interstate 65 between mile markers 53 and 82. Interstate 24 between mile markers 52 and 80. Interstate 840 between mile markers 28 and 76. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.
